plants.name: Chrysanthemum morifolium
plants.description: Chrysanthemums are popular autumn-flowering plants cultivated worldwide, known for their vibrant, daisy-like flower heads that come in many colors. They symbolize longevity and joy in various cultures.
plants.funFact: Mums have been cultivated in China for over 2,500 years and are considered one of the Four Gentlemen in Chinese art.

plants.name: Bougainvillea glabra
plants.description: Bougainvillea is a hardy, evergreen climber or shrub known for its vibrant bracts that surround tiny white flowers, often seen cascading over walls and trellises in warm climates.
plants.bloomingSeason: Year-round in tropical and subtropical zones, peak bloom often in late fall
plants.location: Tropical and subtropical regions, such as South America, Mediterranean, and parts of southern USA
plants.funFact: Bougainvillea bracts, not actual petals, are what give the plant its spectacular colors.

plants.name: Erica carnea
plants.description: A low-growing evergreen shrub native to mountainous regions, it produces bell-shaped flowers in late autumn and early winter, offering color when few other plants bloom.
plants.location: Alps and mountainous regions of Europe
plants.funFact: Winter Heath is valued for its cold hardiness and ability to bloom under snow cover.

plants.name: Salvia greggii
plants.description: A drought-tolerant shrub native to Texas and Mexico that produces tubular flowers attracting hummingbirds throughout autumn, adding vibrant color to dry landscapes.
